intro: Petraeovitex multiflora var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy petraeovitex, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly serrated edge. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
